intro: Rondeletia calycosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or red velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, which gives it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
